Introduction

Cocoro, formerly known as Kokoro, is a Japanese singer and dancer under LAPONE Entertainment and LAPONE GIRLS, formerly under FNC Entertainment and
Avex Artist Academy. She is a member and Vocalist of the Japanese girl group ME:I and she was a former member and the Lead Dancer and Sub Vocalist of the South Korean girl group Cherry Bullet.

On January 21, 2019, she made her official debut as a member of the South Korean girl group Cherry Bullet with the single mini album "Let's Play Cherry Bullet" with "Q & A" serving as the title track. On December 13, 2019, it was announced that she, along with Lin Lin and Ju (Formerly Mirae), would be leaving the group after terminating their contracts with FNC Entertainment.

In 2023, she participated in the survival show "Produce 101 Japan: The Girls" where she ended up ranking 11th place, securing her spot as a member of the Japanese girl group ME:I. On April 17, 2024, she made her debut as a member of the Japanese girl group ME:I with the single mini album "MIRAI" with "'Click" serving as the title track.
